Description: Body sherd of East Greek pottery closed vase; exterior, dull cream slip: goat browsing to left (head, tip of antler, neck, shoulder with added red anforelegs and one hindleg remaining); rosettes, strokes, crosses as filling ornament; below wide streaky brown band below, with superimposed added white and red bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.414)
